description.narrative: In November 2008 AusAID launched the strategy "Development for All: Towards a disability-inclusive Australian aid program 2009-2014". Following the launching of the strategy the AusAID DG approved $0.5 million to implement the strategy of which $0.3 million was allocated to the East Timor program. The government of East Timor has identified disability as one of its National Priorities for 2009 and in the 2009 Budget, funding was allocated to the Ministry of Social Solidarity (MoSS) to strengthen the Disability Working Group. This initiative will: (1) build the capacity of counterparts in MoSS to develop policy skills and build ownership for the national policy across the government; and (2) develop the Community Based Rehabilitation national policy and program procedures and build community based rehabilitation skills of MoSS staff. The total value of this initiative is $0.9 million over 3 years, starting 2009-10.
